$AMZN TO PAY NEW YORK TIMES $25M/YEAR TO LICENSE CONTENT FOR AI TRAINING & ALEXA SUMMARIES

$PANW TO ACQUIRE $CYBR FOR $25B

Palo Alto is clearly positioning for what the next wave of cybersecurity actually looks like: securing not just users and passwords, but every AI agent, every machine credential, every autonomous workflow that lives inside the enterprise stack.

CyberArk gives them that control layer.

Now, has the market punished them for it? Absolutely. Palo Alto has shed over $15B in value since the rumor broke -- more than half the value of the deal itself. That‚Äôs wild. But that also tells me this might be the exact kind of misunderstood bet that ends up aging well.

Because if you believe AI is going to reshape how companies operate (which I do) -- and that every agent, every API, every LLM query needs to be verified, secured, and audited -- then this is the right acquisition at the right time.
The PEG ratio combines a company‚Äôs P/E multiple with its earnings growth rate -- giving you a valuation that adjusts for how fast the business is actually growing.

PEG RATIO IS THE SLEEPER VALUATION METRIC MOST IGNORE

PEG under 1 = mispriced growth. Over 2 = danger zone.

On both the @RiskReversal podcast and on my @CNBCClosingBell appearance with @michaelsantoli, I've remarked investors appear to me a bit complacent about tariff risks; because they haven't hit in the way some (incorrectly) forecast, nor as quickly, some are assuming they won't hit at all. 

Perhaps.

The point is that between tariff delays, inventory build, company mitigation efforts and goods already over water on the way, some percentage of the "tariff impact" was going to take time to be felt. That's not to say worst case, Smoot Hawley type forecasts are guaranteed; they are not. Just that some additional impact *is* coming.

But don't take my word for it. Here are some comments from companies that have recently reported.

Economists who translate the CPI and PPI into the PCE expect monthly core inflation firmed in June. BEA reports this on Thursday.

Core PCE estimate: +0.29% (highest since February), which would push the year-over-year to 2.8%

Headline PCE: +0.32% (y/y rises to 2.5%)

22 Trading Rules You Need to Know

1. Ignore Opinions - Price Action Tells You What Matters

2. When the $SPX is above the 8 & 21 day moving averages, be long leading stocks in leading sectors

3. Get Tactical When SPX Breaks the 8 & 21 Day

4. Don‚Äôt Hold Stocks Under the 200 Day as Swing Longs

5. Use a Tier System to Scale In and Out of Positions

6. Focus on a Small Number of Stocks You Know Well

7. Take Notice of Stocks That Hold Post-Earnings Gaps

8. Never Short a Growth Stock on Valuation

9. Never Short an Index on a Macro Prediction

10. Only Short When the Price Action Indicates a Drop

11. Don‚Äôt Bet on Takeovers or Short Squeezes

12. Only Take Options Into Earnings, Never Stocks

13. Use Post-Earnings Highs/Lows to Find Key Levels

14. Use Day 1 Highs/Lows in IPOs to See FOMO & Fear 

15. Don‚Äôt Stop Out Based on P&L or Percentages

16. Stop Out When the Trade Changes

17. Turn Losing Trades Into Lessons Learned

18. Let the Trend Be Your Friend Until It Turns on You

19. Hold More Cash in Choppier Tapes

20. Watch the Reaction to News, Not the News Itself

21. Never Revenge Trade - Accept What‚Äôs Done Is Done 

22. There Is Always a New Setup Around the Corner

I almost always workout at the end of every intermittent fast. It is the best thing I have ever done for myself. 

Working out at the end of long fasts helps reduce muscle wasting by sending growth signals. Also rockets ketones.
Insanity and greatness are next door neighbors.
